(Simplified: 鲛)
Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 交 indicates the sound; 魚 (fish) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 魚 [ yú ] fish
    • 交 [ jiāo ] to connect; to deliver, to exchange; to intersect; to mix
①(鮫魚)即“鯊魚”。
②(鮫人)神話傳說中生活在海中的人，其淚珠能變成珍珠。亦作“蛟人”。
③(鮫綃)神話傳說鮫人所織的綃，極薄，後用以泛指薄紗。
鮫人 [ jiāo rén ]: mermaid
鮫魚 [ jiāo yú ]: shark

鮫字的基本解释

鮫
jiāo
见“鲛”。

鮫字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jiāo］
［《廣韻》古肴切，平肴，見。］
“鲛1”的繁体字。
(1)海中鲨鱼。
(2)古代传说谓鱼二千斤为鲛。
(3)通“蛟”。参见“鮫龍”。

鮫字的康熙字典解释

【亥集中】【魚字部】　鮫； 康熙笔画：17； 页码：页1469第22
【唐韻】古肴切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】居肴切，?音交。【說文】海魚，皮可飾刀。【山海經】漳水東南流注于睢，其中多鮫魚，皮可飾刀劒，口錯治材角。【註】鮫，鮒魚類也。皮有珠文而堅，尾長三四尺，末有毒，螫人。【述異記】魚虎老，變爲鮫魚。【通雅】鮫，海鯊魚之最大者也。【本草】陳藏器曰：鮫魚出南海。似鼈無腳而有尾。一名沙魚，一名鰒魚。李時珍或言：本作?，?譌爲鮫。鮫長丈許，腹有兩洞，貯水養子，一腹容三四子，朝從口出，暮還入母腹。【史記·禮書】鮫韅。【註】徐廣曰：鮫魚皮可以飾服器。【後漢·輿服志】皆以白珠鮫爲?口之飾。【荀子·議兵篇】楚人鮫革犀兕以爲甲。【註】以鮫魚皮及犀兕爲甲。又官名。【左傳·昭二十年】澤之萑蒲，舟鮫守之。【註】舟鮫，官名也。【疏】鮫，大魚之名，澤中有水有魚，故以舟鮫爲官名也。又鮫人。【左思·吳都賦】訪靈夔於鮫人。【註】鮫人居水中。【述異記】鮫人水居如魚，不廢機織，眼泣則成珠。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jiāo］
["Guangyun" ancient dishes cut, flat dishes, see. ]
Traditional characters for "鲛1".
(1) Sharks in the sea.
(2) The ancient legend said that two thousand catties of fish are mackerel.
(3) Through "jiao". See "Mailong".
shark
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Collection] [Fish Character Department] 　鲛; Kangxi Strokes: 17; Page Number: Page 1469 22
[Tang Yun] Ancient delicacy cut [Ji Yun] [Rhyme] [Zheng Yun] Ju delicacy cut, sound intercourse. [Said the text] Marine fish, the skin can be decorated with a knife. [Shanhai Jing] Zhangshui flows southeast to Sui, where there are many mackerel, the skin can be decorated with knives, and the mouth is wrong for the corners of the material. [Note] Shark, crucian carp fish also. The skin is stiff with pearls, the tail is three or four feet long, and the end is poisonous, stinging. [Shu Yi Ji] The old fish and tiger become mackerel. [Tongya] Shark, the largest of the sea sharks. [Materia Medica] Chen Zangqi said: The mackerel went out of the South China Sea. It looks like a turtle has no feet but a tail. A sandfish, a mackerel. Li Shizhen may say: This is a scorpion, 譌 is a mackerel. The shark has two holes in its abdomen. It holds water for foster children, and one belly accommodates three or four sons. It comes out of the mouth and goes back to the mother's belly. 【Historical Records·Book of Rites】韛韅. [Note] Xu Guang said: Mackerel skin can be decorated with clothes. [Later Han·Yufuzhi] All of them use white pearl sharks as their mouthpieces. [Xunzi·Meeting the Soldiers] Chu people's scorpion is considered to be the first. [Note] Use mackerel skin and rhinoceros as armor. Also official name. [Zuo Zhuan·20th Year of Zhao] Zezhi Vupu, Zhou Qiang Shouzhi. [Note] Zhouyu, official name is also. 【Sparse】The mackerel is the name of the big fish. There are fish in the water, so the boat mackerel is also the official name. Another shark. 【Zuo Si·Wu Du Fu】Interview with Lingkui Yuqiren. [Note] The shark lives in the water. [Shu Yi Ji] The sharks live like fish in water, do not waste woven knitting, and they become pearls when they weep.
